question: Two similar galvanometers are covered into an ammeter and a milliammeter. The shunt resistance of ammeter as compared to the shunt resistance of milliammeter will be
explanation: An ammeter measures larger current (<katex>$I$</katex>) than a milliammeter.
Since <katex>$S$</katex> is inversely proportional to range <katex>$I$</katex>, the ammeter (higher range) requires a smaller (less) shunt resistance.
